intro: Malvastrum aurantiacum, commonly known as the scarlet mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its vibrant red to orange-pink flowers, which bloom in late summer and early fall. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are hairy and often reddish in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial in arid and semi-arid environments. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other mallow plants known for their showy flowers and fibrous stems.
